alert.note: Alert for Guam; Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 13 at 3:17AM ChST until December 14 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...North and east facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM Tuesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large north and east swell are expected to slowly subside beginning today. Surf along east facing reefs could fall below hazardous levels of 12 feet sometime today, with surf along north facing reefs possibly falling below hazardous levels of 9 feet tonight. East swell may take a little longer to subside, and as such, a high rip current risk may extend past Tuesday afternoon, possibly lasting through Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should stay out of the water along north and east facing shores. Elsewhere, swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, swim in a direction following the shoreline until you are out of the current, then head in to shore.
